intro: Seseli tortuosum, commonly known as the twisted seseli, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Seseli tortuosum is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
